[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 82] [First Occurrence Guarantee] Is it guaranteed that for duplicates, the first occurrence is always kept and later ones filtered, or could ordering vary? (High)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup()] [Batch Processing Attack] Can attackers submit multiple blocks simultaneously to different validators causing resource exhaustion through parallel dedup operations? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 24] [Expensive Hash Exploitation] Since the comment explicitly states hash calculation is expensive, can this be leveraged for asymmetric DoS where attack cost is lower than defense cost? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup()] [Platform Independence] Is the deduplication algorithm guaranteed to produce identical results across different operating systems, CPU architectures, and Rust compiler versions? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 64-66] [Parallel Execution Consistency] Could differences in CPU core counts or thread scheduling cause validators to process duplicates differently? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup()] [Endianness Issues] Are all hash and authenticator comparisons endianness-independent to ensure consistency across different architectures? (Medium)
